page.title: 06The Gt.Orme- Heathland
page.content: Dominant on the Great Orme heathland are the yellow{Common Gorse,}the golden yellow{Western Gorse, Ling}and {Bell Heather.}These plants give nesting cover for the{Stonechat}and the{Goldcrest. There are 55{Feral Goats}on the Great Orme. These feed on the heathland plants. They are descended from a pair of goats from the{Windsor Royal Herd which were given to{Sir Savage Mostyn around 1880. They roam around the Orme and frequently cross Marine Drive in search of fresh pasture. So elusive are these goats that there are many residents of Llandudno who have lived in the town all their lives without ever having seen them.
